page.title: 03CUSTOMS IN ENFIELD
page.content: Customs in Enfield In the summer months,but particularly in June and July, many local groups and organisations hold summer fetes to raise funds.Each fete has its own style but some features are common to most.There is usually some form of special display,which could be dancing,a parade, or a special presentation by an organisation such as the police or armed forces.There are many different types of stalls and sideshows which offer small prizes . Larger prizes are offered in raffles,which are drawn at the end of the fete. The Enfield Hospitals fete is one of the largest in this area.In 1985 it raised Â£5000 to provide minibuses for hospitals.The Mayors and Mayoresses of Enfield and Broxbourne attend the fete.
